data.title: Poland in Flames v1
data.meta_description: Poland in Flames v1 - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. The document summarizes the political situation leading up to the German invasion of Poland in September 1939. It discusses territorial disputes over places like the Polish Corridor and Danzig that Germany wanted to annex. It also describes failed negotiations between Germany and Poland, as well as agreements made between Germany and the Soviet Union to allow the invasion and partition of Poland. The document then outlines Operation Himmler, a false flag operation carried out by German forces to stage provocations and make it appear Poland had provoked Germany into war. On September 1st, Hitler signed the order to begin the invasion of Poland, starting World War II.
